clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Cardiac Rehabilitation on Postoperatory of Coronary Artery Bypass Graft.
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Effects of Different Physical Therapy on Cardiac Rehabilitation in Post Operatory Period of Coronary Artery Bypass Graft: Randomized Clinical Trial.

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

clinical_study.source: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

brief_summary.textblock: Randomized Clinical Trial to evaluate the use of different techniques of physical therapy on recovery of functional capacity, pulmonary function and respiratory muscle strength in the period of hospital stay after coronary artery bypass graft.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline in functional capacity at seven days and thirty days after surgery
primary_outcome.description: functional capacity evaluated by six-minute walk test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline in respiratory muscle strength at seven days and thirty days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Both PImax and PEmax were obtained using a pressure transducer

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline in lung function at seven days and thirty days after surgery

intervention.intervention_name: Combination of four techniques of physiotherapy
intervention.description: The patients receive conventional physiotherapy, expiratory positive airway pressure, inspiratory muscle training and physical exercise. Twice daily for seven days

intervention.intervention_name: Combination of three techniques of physiotherapy
intervention.description: Patients receive conventional physiotherapy, expiratory positive airway pressure and physical exercise. Twice daily for seven days

intervention.intervention_name: Combination of two techniques of physiotherapy
intervention.description: Patients receive conventional physiotherapy,expiratory positive airway pressure respiratory muscle training. Twice daily for seven days
Patients receive conventional physiotherapy and expiratory positive airway pressure. Twice daily for seven days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-Patients are recruited from the waiting list for a first CABG intervention at the Porto Alegre Clinical Hospital.
Exclusion Criteria:
- chronic renal failure,
- unstable angina,
- moderate or severe valve disease,
- complex cardiac arrhythmia,
- stroke,
- inability to exercise the lower limbs,
- subjects with forced expiratory volume in 1 second less than 70% of predicted
